comment:
* An event describing a mouse button click interaction originating from a remote device.
 *
 * @hide

variables.name: ACTION_BUTTON_PRESS
variables.comment: Action indicating the mouse button has been pressed.

variables.name: ACTION_BUTTON_RELEASE
variables.comment: Action indicating the mouse button has been released.

variables.name: BUTTON_PRIMARY
variables.comment: Action indicating the mouse button involved in this event is in the left position.

variables.name: BUTTON_TERTIARY
variables.comment: Action indicating the mouse button involved in this event is in the middle position.

variables.name: BUTTON_SECONDARY
variables.comment: Action indicating the mouse button involved in this event is in the right position.

variables.name: BUTTON_BACK
variables.comment:
* Action indicating the mouse button involved in this event is intended to go back to the
     * previous.

variables.name: BUTTON_FORWARD
variables.comment:
* Action indicating the mouse button involved in this event is intended to move forward to the
     * next.

methods.name: public void writeToParcel(@NonNull Parcel parcel, int parcelableFlags)
public int getButtonCode()
methods.comment: * Returns the button code associated with this event.

methods.name: public int getAction()
methods.comment: * Returns the action associated with this event.

methods.name: public long getEventTimeNanos()
methods.comment:
* Returns the time this event occurred, in the {@link SystemClock#uptimeMillis()} time base but
     * with nanosecond (instead of millisecond) precision.
     *
     * @see InputEvent#getEventTime()

methodNames: public void writeToParcel(@NonNull Parcel parcel, int parcelableFlags)
